definition: lit. lips/fig. glib talk
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
leather/skin/fur/CL:張|张[zhang1]/pico- (one trillionth)/naughty
surname Pi
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to talk glibly/to talk big/to be all talk
see 動嘴皮|动嘴皮[dong4 zui3 pi2]
to wear out the skin of one's teeth (idiom); pointlessly blather/to talk incessant nonsense/blah blah
to wear out one's lips (idiom)/to talk until one is blue in the face/to repeat again and again

sentences.english: You're stronger than you look with a smart ass mouth to match.
sentences.chinese: 你比看上去要強大，還有張會耍嘴皮子的臭嘴。

sentences.english: Too bad your fists aren't as fast as your mouth.
sentences.chinese: 只可惜您那鐵拳頭及不上你的嘴皮子快啊。

sentences.english: But we can't be satisfied with studies and paper and talk.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我們不能只滿足於研究和文件以及動動嘴皮子。

sentences.english: An upstart like that dares to bandy words with me!
sentences.chinese: 這樣一個小財主也敢跟我逗嘴皮子。

sentences.english: Instead, they are only concerned with their ratings. Fans of Zeng, meanwhile, continue to show their support.
sentences.chinese: 歌迷也無所謂，支持一位偶像不過是動動嘴皮子而已。

sentences.english: The white jade hall continues tel again inside and Tang whet the mouth skin son way after the dragon.
sentences.chinese: 白玉堂繼續再電話裏和唐繼龍磨着嘴皮子道。

sentences.english: The time for partisan bickering is over.
sentences.chinese: 黨派之間動嘴皮子的時間已經過去了。

sentences.english: Meetings such as this are usually about talk.
sentences.chinese: 像這樣的會議一般是動嘴皮子的。

sentences.english: Nobody will believe you, and it won't do you any good except maybe to vent a bit.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人會相信你，耍嘴皮子對你沒有任何好處。

sentences.english: His mouth put that hole in your gut?
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴皮子捅的你肚子上的那個洞？

sentences.english: Just don't expect to have it with a clerk.
sentences.chinese: 不過別指望可以找個店員就此耍耍嘴皮子。

to talk
to wear out the skin of one's teeth (idiom); pointlessly blather/to talk incessant nonsense/blah blah
to show off with clever talk/big-headed/a smart-ass
to have a silver tongue/to have the gift of the gab
pinyin: san1 cun4 bu4 lan4 zhi1 she2

definition: can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
lit. to have a tongue like a reed (idiom)/fig. to have a glib tongue
a couple of times/to repeat the same/the same old trick/tricks of the trade
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
eloquence
pen/an effective writer
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
posturing/pretentious/affected
ability/skill
source material/original story
face/cheek
